std::vector< SystemsBiologyWorkbench::ModuleDescriptor > * SystemsBiologyWorkbench::SBW::getModuleDescriptors (  bool    includeRunning = false,
bool    localOnly = false
)  [inline, static]
 

returns module descriptors for all the modules known to the broker.

the result should be deallocated using delete.

Parameters:
includeRunning  the result should include running but unregistered modules.
localOnly  the result should include only those modules register with the broker on this host
Returns:
module descriptors for all the modules known to the broker.

SystemsBiologyWorkbench::Module SystemsBiologyWorkbench::SBW::getModuleInstance (  std::string    moduleName )  [inline, static]
 

locates an instance of a given module, creating a new module instance where necessary.

Whether an new module instance is created depends on the management type of the module.

Parameters:

Returns:
instance of module with given identification string.

void SystemsBiologyWorkbench::SBW::link (  std::string    hostname )  [inline, static]
 

request that the broker connects to a remote broker.

This ensures that the SBW environment appears to be a combination of the facilities of all the linked brokers. This is the prefered mechanism for accessing remote resources.

Parameters:
hostname  the hostname of machine on which you wish to connect.

Definition at line 161 of file SBWHighLevel.h.

References SystemsBiologyWorkbench::SBWLowLevel::link.

bool SystemsBiologyWorkbench::SBW::processArguments (  int    argc,
char *    argv[]
)  [inline, static]
 

Convenience function for performing the tasks required for handling the -sbwdebug to an application.

This method must be passed the array of command-line arguments passed to the application. This method then checks for the presence of -sbwdebug and runs SBWDebug::setTraceMode(). Returns whether the application should either register itself or run as a module based on the command line.

Parameters:
argc  an integer indicating the number of arguments passed to the program on the command line
argv  an array of strings comprising the set of arguments passed to the program on the command line
Returns:
whether the command line contains either -sbwregister or -sbwmodule ie whether the application should either register itself or run as a module respectively.

Definition at line 179 of file SBWHighLevel.h.

References SystemsBiologyWorkbench::SBWLowLevel::processArguments.
